info.title: Calendar
info.description: The Calendar APIs allow developers to interface with [Zoom Calendar](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/calendar/#tag/acl/POST/calendars/{calId}/acl) features programmatically. These APIs enable applications to manage calendar events, automate scheduling, sync across platforms, and integrate Zoom Calendar with third-party apps for seamless event management.

get.summary: List ACL rules of specified calendar
get.description:
Returns the rules in the access control list for the calendar.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read`,`calendar:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:list_acl`,`calendar:read:list_acl:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call, the `calendarList.list` method.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries returned on one result page.

parameters.name: showDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted ACLs in the result.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token that specifies which result page to return.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a response body with the following structure:

nextPageToken.description: The token that accesses the next page of this result.

items.description: The list of rules for the access control list.

id.description: The identifier of the ACL rule.

scope.description: The extent to which calendar access is granted by this ACL rule.

value.description: The name of the domain
The email address of a user or group, depending on the scope type.

role.description: The role assigned to the scope.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Creates an access control list rule.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write`,`calendar:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write:acl`,`calendar:write:acl:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call, the `calendarList.list` method.

scope.description: The extent to which calendar access is granted by this ACL rule.

value.description: he name of a domain.
The email address of a user or group.

role.description: The role assigned to the scope.

200.description: If successful, this method returns an ACL resource in the response body.

id.description: The identifier of the ACL rule.

scope.description: The extent to which calendar access is granted by this ACL rule.

value.description: The name of a domain.
The email address of a user or group.

role.description: The role assigned to the scope.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Returns an access control list (ACL) rule.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read`,`calendar:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:acl`,`calendar:read:acl:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the `calendarList.list` method.

parameters.name: aclId
parameters.description: The ACL rule identifier.

200.description: If successful, this method returns an ACL resource in the response body.

id.description: The identifier of the ACL rule.

scope.description: The extent to which calendar access is granted by this ACL rule.

value.description: The name of the domain.
The email address of a user or group, depending on the scope type.

role.description: The role assigned to the scope.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

delete.description:
Deletes an access control list (ACL) rule.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write`,`calendar:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:delete:acl`,`calendar:delete:acl:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the `calendarList.list` method.

parameters.name: aclId
parameters.description: The ACL rule identifier.

204.description: If successful, the specified ACL rule is deleted and this method returns an empty response body.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

patch.description:
Updates an access control list rule.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write`,`calendar:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:update:acl`,`calendar:update:acl:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the `calendarList.list` method.

parameters.name: aclId
parameters.description: The ACL rule identifier.

requestBody.description: This field supplies the relevant portions of an ACL resource, according to the rules of patch semantics.

scope.description: The extent to which calendar access is granted by this ACL rule.

value.description: The name of a domain.
The email address of a user or group.

role.description: The role assigned to the scope.

200.description: If successful, this method returns an ACL resource in the response body.

id.description: The identifier of the ACL rule.

scope.description: The extent to which calendar access is granted by this ACL rule.

value.description: The name of a domain.
The email address of a user or group.

role.description: The role assigned to the scope.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.summary: List the calendars in the user's own calendarList
get.description:
Returns the calendars in the user's calendar list.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read`,`calendar:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:list_calendar_lists`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: userIdentifier
parameters.description: The user identifier. It identifies which user's calendarList to operate.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries returned on one result page.

parameters.name: minAccessRole
parameters.description: The minimum access role for the user in the returned entries.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token that specifies which result page to return.

parameters.name: showDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted calendar list entries in the result.

parameters.name: showHidden
parameters.description: Whether to show hidden entries.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a response body with the following structure:

nextPageToken.description: The token that accesses the next page of this result.

items.description: The calendars in the user's calendar list.

location.description: The geographic location of the calendar as free-form text.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar.

backgroundColor.description: The main color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format.

foregroundColor.description: The foreground color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format.

hidden.description: Whether the calendar has been hidden from the list.

selected.description: Whether the calendar content shows up in the calendar UI.

accessRole.description: The effective access role that the authenticated user has on the calendar.

defaultReminders.description: The default reminders for non-all day events that the authenticated user has for this calendar.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

defaultAllDayReminders.description: The default reminders for all day events that the authenticated user has for this calendar.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

notifications.description: The list of notifications set for this calendar.

method.description: The method that delivers the notification.

notificationSettings.description: The notifications that the authenticated user is receiving for this calendar.

primary.description: Whether the calendar is the primary calendar of the authenticated user.

deleted.description: Whether this calendar list entry has been deleted from the calendar list.

summaryOverride.description: The summary that the authenticated user has set for this calendar.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.summary: Insert an existing calendar to the user's own calendarList
post.description:
Inserts an existing calendar into the user's calendar list. The user can be `me` or a given calendar ID. 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write`,`calendar:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write:calendar_list`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: userIdentifier
parameters.description: The user identifier. It indicates which user's calendarList to operate.

parameters.name: colorRgbFormat
parameters.description: This parameter must be set to true when the user wants to change the foreground or background color.

location.description: The geographic location of the calendar as free-form text.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar.

backgroundColor.description: The main color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format.

foregroundColor.description: The foreground color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format.

hidden.description: Whether the calendar has been hidden from the list.

selected.description: Whether the calendar content shows up in the calendar UI.

accessRole.description: The effective access role that the authenticated user has on the calendar.

defaultReminders.description: The default reminders for non-all day events that the authenticated user has for this calendar.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

defaultAllDayReminders.description: The default reminders for all day events that the authenticated user has for this calendar.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

notifications.description: The list of notifications set for this calendar.

method.description: The method that delivers the notification.

notificationSettings.description: The notifications that the authenticated user is receiving for this calendar.

primary.description: Whether the calendar is the primary calendar of the authenticated user.

deleted.description: Whether this calendar list entry has been deleted from the calendar list.

summaryOverride.description: The summary that the authenticated user has set for this calendar.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a CalendarList resource in the response body.

location.description: The geographic location of the calendar as free-form text.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar.

backgroundColor.description: The main color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format.

foregroundColor.description: The foreground color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format

hidden.description: Whether the calendar has been hidden from the list.

selected.description: Whether the calendar content shows up in the calendar UI.

accessRole.description: The effective access role that the authenticated user has on the calendar.

defaultReminders.description: The default reminders for non-all day events that the authenticated user has for this calendar.

method.description: The method that this reminder uses.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

defaultAllDayReminders.description: The default reminders for all day events that the authenticated user has for this calendar.

method.description: The method that this reminder uses.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

notifications.description: The list of notifications set for this calendar.

method.description: The method that delivers the notification.

notificationSettings.description: The notifications that the authenticated user is receiving for this calendar.

primary.description: Whether the calendar is the primary calendar of the authenticated user.

deleted.description: Whether this calendar list entry has been deleted from the calendar list.

summaryOverride.description: The summary that the authenticated user has set for this calendar.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.summary: Get a specified calendar from the user's own calendarList
get.description:
Returns a calendar from the user's calendar list. The user can be `me` or a given calendar ID. 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read`,`calendar:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:calendar_list`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: userIdentifier
parameters.description: The user identifier. It indicates Which user's calendarList to operate.

parameters.name: calendarId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. It specifies which calendarList entry in the user's calendarList to operate on. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the `List all calendars in a calendarlist` API.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a CalendarList resource in the response body.

location.description: The geographic location of the calendar as free-form text.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar.

backgroundColor.description: The main color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format.

foregroundColor.description: The foreground color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format.

hidden.description: Whether the calendar has been hidden from the list.

selected.description: Whether the calendar content shows up in the calendar UI.

accessRole.description: The effective access role that the authenticated user has on the calendar.

defaultReminders.description: The default reminders for non-all day events that the authenticated user has for this calendar.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

defaultAllDayReminders.description: The default reminders for all day events that the authenticated user has for this calendar.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

notifications.description: The list of notifications set for this calendar.

method.description: The method that delivers the notification.

notificationSettings.description: The notifications that the authenticated user is receiving for this calendar.

primary.description: Whether the calendar is the primary calendar of the authenticated user.

deleted.description: Whether this calendar list entry has been deleted from the calendar list.

summaryOverride.description: The summary that the authenticated user has set for this calendar.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

delete.summary: Delete an existing calendar from the user's own calendarList
delete.description:
Removes a calendar from the user's calendar list. The user can be `me` or a given calendar ID. 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write`,`calendar:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:delete:calendar_list`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: userIdentifier
parameters.description: The user identifier.  It indicates which user's calendarList to operate.

parameters.name: calendarId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. It specifies which calendarList entry in the user's calendarList to operate. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the `List all calendars in a calendarlist` API.

204.description: If successful, the specified calendar is removed from the user's own calendarList. This method returns an empty response body.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

patch.summary: Update an existing calendar in the user's own calendarList
patch.description:
Updates an existing calendar on the user's calendar list.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write`,`calendar:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:update:calendar_list`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: colorRgbFormat

get.description:
Returns metadata for a calendar.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read`,`calendar:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:calendar`,`calendar:read:calendar:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the `calendarList.list` method.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a calendar's resource in the response body.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar.

location.description: The geographic location of the calendar as free-form text.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

delete.summary: Delete a calendar owned by a user

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar ID of the calendar to be removed.

204.description: If successful, the specified calendar is deleted and this method returns an empty response body.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

Updates metadata for a calendar.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write`,`calendar:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:update:calendar`,`calendar:update:calendar:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the `calendarList.list` method.

requestBody.description: This field supplies the relevant portions of a calendar's resource.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar.

location.description: The geographic location of the calendar as free-form text.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a Calendars resource in the response body.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar.

location.description: The geographic location of the calendar as free-form text.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.summary: Get the color definitions for calendars and events
get.description:
Returns the color definitions for calendars and events.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read`,`calendar:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:color`,`calendar:read:color:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

200.description: If successful, this method returns a color's resource in the response body.

updated.description: The last modification time of the color palette.

calendar.description: A global palette of calendar colors, mapping from the color ID to its definition.

event.description: A global palette of event colors, mapping from the color ID to its definition.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.summary: List events on the specified calendar
get.description:
Returns events on the specified calendar.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:admin`,`calendar:read`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:list_events`,`calendar:read:list_events:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the `calendarList.list` method.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of events returned on one result page.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The order of the events returned in the result.

parameters.name: showDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted events (with status equals "cancelled") in the result. Cancelled instances of recurring events (but not the underlying recurring event) will still be included if `showDeleted` and `singleEvents` are both False. If `showDeleted` and `singleEvents` are both True and only single instances of deleted events (but not the underlying recurring events) are returned. The default is False. Optional.

parameters.name: singleEvents
parameters.description: Whether to expand recurring events into instances and only return single one-off events and instances of recurring events, but not the underlying recurring events themselves.  The default is False. Optional.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token that specifies which result page to return. Optional.

parameters.name: timeMax
parameters.description: The upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by start time. It must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset, for example, 2011-06-03T10:00:00-07:00, 2011-06-03T10:00:00Z. Milliseconds may be provided but are ignored. If `timeMin` is set, `timeMax` must be greater than `timeMin`.

parameters.name: timeMin
parameters.description: The lower bound (exclusive) for an event's end time from which to filter. Optional. The default is not to filter by end time. It must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset, for example, 2011-06-03T10:00:00-07:00, 2011-06-03T10:00:00Z. Milliseconds can be provided but are ignored. If `timeMax` is set, `timeMin` must be smaller than `timeMax`.

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The time zone in the response. The default is the time zone of the calendar. Optional.

parameters.name: syncToken
parameters.description: The `syncToken` records the time of the last event list. By providing this parameter, the event list results will only include the events that are updated after last sync.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a response body with the following structure:

updated.description: The last modification time of the calendar (as a RFC3339 timestamp). Read-only.

timeZone.description: **Read-only** The time zone of the calendar.

accessRole.description: **Read-only** The user's access role for this calendar.

defaultReminders.description: The default reminders on the calendar for the authenticated user.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

nextPageToken.description: The token to access the next page of this result.

items.description: The list of events on the calendar.

date.description: The date, in the format "yyyy-mm-dd", if this is an all-day event.

dateTime.description: The time, as a combined date-time value (formatted according to RFC3339). A time zone offset is required unless a time zone is explicitly specified in `timeZone`.

timeZone.description: The time zone in which there is a specified time. (Formatted as an IANA Time Zone Database name, e.g. "Europe/Zurich".) For recurring events wwe require this field. It specifies the time zone used to expand the recurrence. For single events this field is optional and indicates a custom time zone for the event's start or end.

start.description: The (inclusive) start time of the event. For a recurring event, this is the start time of the first instance.

date.description: The date, in the format "yyyy-mm-dd", if this is an all-day event.

dateTime.description: The time, as a combined date-time value (formatted according to RFC3339). We require a time zone offset unless you explicitly specify it in `timeZone`.

timeZone.description: The time zone in which the time is specified. (Formatted as an IANA Time Zone Database name, e.g. "Europe/Zurich".) For recurring events we require this field. It specifies the time zone used to expand the recurrence. For single events this field is optional and indicates a custom time zone for the event's start or end.

end.description: The (exclusive) end time of the event. For a recurring event, this is the end time of the first instance.

additionalGuests.description: **Optional** The number of additional guests. The default is 0.

optional.description: **Optional** Whether this is an optional attendee. The default is False.

resource.description: Whether the attendee is a resource. It only sets when someone adds the attendee to the event for the first time.

colorId.description: The color of the event. This is an ID referring to an entry in the event section of the colors definition (use `color.get`)

guestsCanInviteOthers.description: **Optional** Whether attendees other than the organizer can invite others to the event. The default is True.

guestsCanModify.description: **Optional** Whether attendees other than the organizer can modify the event. The default is False.

guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.description: **Optional** Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are. The default is True.

location.description: The geographic location of the event as free-form text.

recurrence.description: The list of RRULE, EXRULE, RDATE and EXDATE lines for a recurring event

useDefault.description: Whether the default reminders of the calendar apply to the event.

overrides.description: If the event doesn't use the default reminders, this field lists the reminders specific to the event. If not, it indicates that no reminders are set for this event.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

reminders.description: The information about the event's reminders for the authenticated user.

transparency.description: Whether the event blocks time on the calendar.

created.description: The creation time of the event.

updated.description: The last modification time of the event.

nextSyncToken.example: The next page token retrieves events changed after returning this result. This system omits it when you add the `nextPageToken`. Users need to retrieve all pages of result before getting the `nextSyncToken`.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.summary: Import event to the specified calendar
post.description:
Imports an event. This operation adds a private copy of an existing event to a calendar.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write`,`calendar:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write:import_event`,`calendar:write:import_event:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

timeZone.description: The time zone in which the time is specified. (Formatted as an IANA Time Zone Database name, e.g. "Europe/Zurich".) For recurring events this field is required and specifies the time zone in which the recurrence is expanded. For single events this field is optional and indicates a custom time zone for the event's start or end.

post.summary: Quick add an event to the specified calendar

Creates an event based on a simple text string.

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write:quick_add_event`,`calendar:write:quick_add_event:admin`

guestsCanModify.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can modify the event. The default is False. Optional.

guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are. The default is True. Optional.

location.description: The geographic location of the event as free-form text.

recurrence.description: The list of RRULE, EXRULE, RDATE and EXDATE lines for a recurring event.

useDefault.description: Whether the default reminders of the calendar apply to the event.

overrides.description: If the event doesn't use the default reminders, this field lists the reminders specific to the event. If not, it indicates that no reminders are set for this event.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

reminders.description: The information about the event's reminders for the authenticated user.

transparency.description: Whether the event blocks time on the calendar.

created.description: The creation time of the event.

updated.description: The last modification time of the event.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.summary: List all instances of the specified recurring event
get.description:
Returns instances of the specified recurring event.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read`,`calendar:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:instance_event`,`calendar:read:instance_event:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the `calendarList.list` method.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The event identifier.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of events returned on one result page.

parameters.name: showDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted events (with status equals "cancelled") in the result. Cancelled instances of recurring events (but not the underlying recurring event) will still be included if `showDeleted` and `singleEvents` are both False. If `showDeleted` and `singleEvents` are both True, only single instances of deleted events (but not the underlying recurring events) are returned. Optional. The default is False.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token that specifies which result page to return. Optional.

parameters.name: timeMax
parameters.description: The upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by start time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset, for example, 2011-06-03T10:00:00-07:00, 2011-06-03T10:00:00Z. Milliseconds may be provided but are ignored. If `timeMin` is set, `timeMax` must be greater than `timeMin`.

parameters.name: timeMin
parameters.description: The lower bound (exclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by end time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset, for example, 2011-06-03T10:00:00-07:00, 2011-06-03T10:00:00Z. Milliseconds may be provided but are ignored. If `timeMax` is set, `timeMin` must be smaller than `timeMax`.

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The time zone in the response. Optional. The default is the time zone of the calendar.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a response body with the following structure:

summary.description: The title of the calendar. Read-only.

description.description: The description of the calendar. Read-only.

updated.description: The last modification time of the calendar (as a RFC3339 timestamp). Read-only.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar. Read-only.

accessRole.description: The user's access role for this calendar. Read-only.

defaultReminders.description: The default reminders on the calendar for the authenticated user.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

nextPageToken.description: The token used to access the next page of this result.

items.description: The list of instances of the event on the calendar.

date.description: The date, in the format "yyyy-mm-dd", if this is an all-day event.

dateTime.description: The time, as a combined date-time value (formatted according to RFC3339). A time zone offset is required unless a time zone is explicitly specified in timeZone.

timeZone.description: The time zone in which the time is specified. (Formatted as an IANA Time Zone Database name, e.g. "Europe/Zurich".) For recurring events this field is required and specifies the time zone in which the recurrence is expanded. For single events this field is optional and indicates a custom time zone for the event start/end.

start.description: The (inclusive) start time of the event. For a recurring event, this is the start time of the first instance.

date.description: The date, in the format "yyyy-mm-dd", if this is an all-day event.

dateTime.description: The time, as a combined date-time value (formatted according to RFC3339). A time zone offset is required unless a time zone is explicitly specified in timeZone.

timeZone.description: The time zone in which the time is specified. (Formatted as an IANA Time Zone Database name, e.g. "Europe/Zurich".) For recurring events this field is required and specifies the time zone in which the recurrence is expanded. For single events this field is optional and indicates a custom time zone for the event start/end.

end.description: The (exclusive) end time of the event. For a recurring event, this is the end time of the first instance.

additionalGuests.description: The number of additional guests. Optional. The default is 0.

optional.description: Whether this is an optional attendee. Optional. The default is False.

resource.description: Whether the attendee is a resource. It can only be set when the attendee is added to the event for the first time.

colorId.description: The color of the event. This is an ID referring to an entry in the event section of the colors definition (use color.get)

guestsCanInviteOthers.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can invite others to the event. Optional. The default is True.

guestsCanModify.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can modify the event. Optional. The default is False.

guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are. Optional. The default is True.

location.description: The geographic location of the event as free-form text.

recurrence.description: The list of RRULE, EXRULE, RDATE and EXDATE lines for a recurring event.

useDefault.description: Whether the default reminders of the calendar apply to the event.

overrides.description: If the event doesn't use the default reminders, this field lists the reminders specific to the event.  If not, it indicates that no reminders are set for this event.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

reminders.description: Information about the event's reminders for the authenticated user.

transparency.description: Whether the event blocks time on the calendar.

created.description: The creation time of the event.

updated.description: The last modification time of the event.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.summary: Move the specified event from a calendar to another specified calendar
post.description:
Moves an event to another calendar, such as changing an event's organizer.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write`,`calendar:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:write:move_event`,`calendar:write:move_event:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: calId
parameters.description: The calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the `calendarList.list` method.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The event identifier.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The calendar identifier of the target calendar where the event is to be moved.

parameters.name: sendUpdates
parameters.description: Whether to send notifications about the creation of the new event. Note that some emails might still be sent.

200.description: If successful, this method returns an Events resource in the response body.

date.description: The date, in the format "yyyy-mm-dd", if this is an all-day event.

dateTime.description: The time, as a combined date-time value (formatted according to RFC3339). A time zone offset is required unless a time zone is explicitly specified in `timeZone`.

timeZone.description: The time zone in which the time is specified. (Formatted as an IANA Time Zone Database name, e.g. "Europe/Zurich".) For recurring events this field is required and specifies the time zone in which the recurrence is expanded. For single events this field is optional and indicates a custom time zone for the event's start or end.

start.description: The (inclusive) start time of the event. For a recurring event, this is the start time of the first instance.

date.description: The date, in the format "yyyy-mm-dd", if this is an all-day event.

dateTime.description: The time, as a combined date-time value (formatted according to RFC3339). A time zone offset is required unless a time zone is explicitly specified in `timeZone`.

timeZone.description: The time zone in which the time is specified. (Formatted as an IANA Time Zone Database name, e.g. "Europe/Zurich".) For recurring events this field is required and specifies the time zone in which the recurrence is expanded. For single events this field is optional and indicates a custom time zone for the event's start or end.

end.description: The (exclusive) end time of the event. For a recurring event, this is the end time of the first instance.

additionalGuests.description: The number of additional guests. Optional. The default is 0.

optional.description: Whether this is an optional attendee. Optional. The default is False.

resource.description: Whether the attendee is a resource. It can only be set when the attendee is added to the event for the first time.

colorId.description: The color of the event. This is an ID referring to an entry in the event section of the colors definition (use `color.get`).

guestsCanInviteOthers.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can invite others to the event. Optional. The default is True.

guestsCanModify.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can modify the event. Optional. The default is False.

guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are. Optional. The default is True.

location.description: The geographic location of the event as free-form text.

recurrence.description: The list of RRULE, EXRULE, RDATE and EXDATE lines for a recurring event.

useDefault.description: Whether the default reminders of the calendar apply to the event.

overrides.description: If the event doesn't use the default reminders, this field lists the reminders specific to the event. If not, it indicates that no reminders are set for this event.

method.description: The method used by this reminder.

minutes.description: The number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

reminders.description: The information about the event's reminders for the authenticated user.

transparency.description: Whether the event blocks time on the calendar.

created.description: The creation time of the event.

updated.description: The last modification time of the event.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.summary: Query freebusy information for a set of calendars
post.description:
Returns free or busy information for a set of calendars.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read`,`calendar:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:list_events`,`calendar:read:list_events:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

timeZone.description: The time zone in the response.

timeMin.description: The start of the interval for the query.

timeMax.description: The end of the interval for the query.

calendarExpansionMax.description: The maximum number of calendars for which FreeBusy information is to be provided.

groupExpansionMax.description: The maximum number of calendar identifiers to be provided for a single group.

items.description: The list of calendars and/or groups to query.

id.description: The identifier of a calendar or a group.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a response body with the following structure:

domain.description: The domain, or broad category, of the error.

reason.description: The specific reason for the error.

busy.description: The list of time ranges during which this calendar should be regarded as busy.

start.description: The (inclusive) start of the time period.

end.description: The (exclusive) end of the time period.

items.description: The list of time ranges during which this calendar should be regarded as busy.

domain.description: The domain, or broad category, of the error.

reason.description: The specific reason for the error.

calendars.description: The list of calendars included in the group.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.summary: List all user calendar settings of the authenticated user
get.description:
Returns all user settings for the authenticated user.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read`,`calendar:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `calendar:read:list_settings`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: userIdentifier
parameters.description: The user identifier. It indicates Which user's calendarList to operate.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries returned on one result page.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token that specifies which result page to return.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a response body with the following structure:

nextPageToken.description: The token that accesses the next page of this result.

id.description: The ID of the user setting.

value.description: The value of the user setting. The format of the value depends on the ID of the setting.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.summary: Get the specified user calendar settings of the authenticated user

parameters.name: userIdentifier
parameters.description: The user identifier.

parameters.name: settingId
parameters.description: The identifier of the user setting. To retrieve calendar IDs, call the 'List all user settings' API.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a setting's resource in the response body.

value.description: The allowed values are `true` or `false`.
The allowed values are positive numbers.

id.description: The combinations of "Modify the event", "Invite others" and "See list of attendees" in an event.

value.description: The allowed values are 0, 1, 2, 3, and 7. These values respesent as bitmap with three digits, from left to right are "Modify the event", "Invite others" and "See list of attendees."

id.description: Whether the week should start on Sunday (0), Monday (1), or Saturday (6).

value.description: The allowed values are 0, 1, and 6.

id.description: The default `addon` type in an event: 1 as Zoom meeting, 2 as phone, and 3 as offline.

value.description: The allowed values are 1, 2, and 3.

id.description: What should the order of day (D), month (M) and year (Y) be when displaying dates.

value.description: The allowed values are MDY, DMY,and YMD.

id.description: The view in the calendar: D as day, W as week, M as month, Y as year, A as schedule, X as 4 days, WW as work week, and N as no fix time.

value.description: The allowed values are D, W, M, Y, A, X, WW, and N.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

patch.summary: Patch the specified user calendar settings of the authenticated user

parameters.name: userIdentifier
parameters.description: The user identifier.

parameters.name: settingId
parameters.description: The ID of the setting to be patched.

id.description: The target setting ID to patch.

value.description: The target setting value to patch.
The patched setting value.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).
